title: Cunard launches cruise that puts passengers in New York for the runway shows
text:
7 shares

Calling all sea-faring fashionistas, the ultimate Fashion Week itinerary has arrived.
Cunard has just announced its very first 'Transatlantic Fashion Week' route: a seven-day voyage across the Atlantic, arriving in New York City on the first day of New York Fashion Week.
And not only will you arrive in one of the world's style capitals in, well, style, you'll also have the opportunity to experience a week of fashion-focused events on board the ship.
The Queen Mary 2 will set sail on a special voyage across the Atlantic in celebration of New York Fashion Week this September
The voyage will be hosted by a number of significant names in the industry, such as fashion historian Colin McDowell and 'Godmother of Fashion' Fern Mallis. (She is also the founder of New York Fashion Week.)
British designer Dame Zandra Rhodes, who has dressed everyone from Freddie Mercury to Jackie Onassis, will also be on hand to reveal designs from her collections.

Take a tour through New York... in 1910: Astonishing images... 'I'm extremely excited to be joining Cunard on board Queen Mary 2 for the very first Transatlantic Fashion Week, 2016,' she said.
'For me, it offers the opportunity to share my knowledge and wonderful experiences from throughout my career in fashion, and give guests a taste of what my collection has to offer.'
The seven-night voyage will sail the traditional Queen Mary route, from Southampton, UK, to New York City
High-profile fashion insiders will also be on board the seven-night cruise, including Dame Zandra Rhodes (left) and 'Godmother of Fashion' Fern Mallis (right)
Designer Ralph Lauren walks the catwalk after his New York Fashion Week show in September 2015
Ralph Lauren is one of the most well-attended show each season, as evidenced by Vogue editor Anna Wintour in the front row
Eight recent graduates from the Royal College of Art will likewise be on board to show off their avant-garde designs - and all looks will be modelled by up-and-coming faces from Storm Models.
It's fitting that the entire venture will take place on board the RMS Queen Mary 2, a brand that has long been renowned for its glamour and high-profile passengers.
Other specially-curated cruise experiences include a culinary tour of British food, which is scheduled to set sail next June on board the Queen Elizabeth.
On the Queen Mary 2, style-savvy guests will be able to take part in exclusive talks about the industry
The Queen Mary 2 will undergo a refurbishment in spring 2016, meaning guests will get to stay in the 'new' staterooms
As part of the special fashion-focused itinerary, passengers will be able to attend workshops, as well as see a bespoke Zandra Rhodes runway show
All three Queens returned to Liverpool on May 25, 2015 to sail along the River Mersey together
But, as is the case with most high-end designer labels, being this stylish is going to cost you.
A balcony stateroom starts from Â£1,699 per person, including all flights and transfers, for the Transatlantic Fashion Week programme.
New York Fashion Week will run from September 8 to 15, 2016, before London Fashion Week begins on September 16.
Angus Struthers, Cunard's Marketing Director, said: 'Cunard has as its heart a celebrated history of guests dressing with style and a sense of occasion, as well as some of the finest dining at sea and of course the glamour of music and dance in the largest ball rooms at sea.
'These very special cruises are sure to entice our most dedicated travellers and those new to cruising who are looking to immerse themselves in the very best of British fashion and food. Dance and music lovers can look forward to being transformed to an era where elaborate Big Band Balls ruled the social circuits, as we celebrate 2016 in style.'
